articles.title: French and Malaysian authorities are investigating Grok for generating sexualized deepfakes
articles.description: France and Malaysia have joined India in condemning Grok for creating sexualized deepfakes of women and minors.
articles.author: Anthony Ha
articles.content: France and Malaysia have joined India in condemning Grok for creating sexualized deepfakes of women and minors.

articles.title: ASUS to unveil AI-powered PC lineup at CES 2026
articles.description: ASUS will launch its CES 2026 product lineup with new AI PCs and technology through a virtual event and a Las Vegas showroom, introducing adaptive devices powered by NPUs to support work, creativity, and everyday life. articles.title: AI agent-driven browser automation for enterprise workflow management
articles.description: Enterprise organizations increasingly rely on web-based applications for critical business processes, yet many workflows remain manually intensive, creating operational inefficiencies and compliance risks. Despite significant technology investments, knowledge workers routinely navigate between eight to twelve different web applications during standard workflows, constantly switching contexts and manually transferring information between systems. Data entry and validation tasks […]

articles.title: Recursive Language Models (RLMs): From MIT’s Blueprint to Prime Intellect’s RLMEnv for Long Horizon LLM Agents
articles.description: Recursive Language Models aim to break the usual trade off between context length, accuracy and cost in large language models. Instead of forcing a model to read a giant prompt in one pass, RLMs treat the prompt as an external environment and let the model decide how to inspect it with code, then recursively call […] The post Recursive Language Models (RLMs): From MIT’s Blueprint to Prime Intellect’s RLMEnv for Long Horizon LLM Agents appeared first on MarkTechPost.
articles.author: Asif Razzaq
articles.content: Recursive Language Models aim to break the usual trade off between context length, accuracy and cost in large language models. Instead of forcing a model to read a giant prompt in one pass, RLMs treat the prompt as an external environment and let the model decide how to inspect it with code, then recursively call […] The post Recursive Language Models (RLMs): From MIT’s Blueprint to Prime Intellect’s RLMEnv for Long Horizon LLM Agents appeared first on MarkTechPost.

articles.title: How AI is reshaping work and who gets to do it, according to Mercor’s CEO
articles.description: Three-year-old startup Mercor has become a $10 billion middleman in AI’s data gold rush. The company connects AI labs like OpenAI and Anthropic with former employees of Goldman Sachs, McKinsey, and white-shoe law firms, paying them up to $200 an hour to share their industry expertise and train the AI models that could eventually automate their former employers out of business. Today we’re bringing […]
articles.author: Theresa Loconsolo
articles.content: Three-year-old startup Mercor has become a $10 billion middleman in AI’s data gold rush. The company connects AI labs like OpenAI and Anthropic with former employees of Goldman Sachs, McKinsey, and white-shoe law firms, paying them up to $200 an hour to share their industry expertise and train the AI models that could eventually automate their former employers out of business. Today we’re bringing […]

articles.title: Move Beyond Chain-of-Thought with Chain-of-Draft on Amazon Bedrock
articles.description: This post explores Chain-of-Draft (CoD), an innovative prompting technique introduced in a Zoom AI Research paper Chain of Draft: Thinking Faster by Writing Less, that revolutionizes how models approach reasoning tasks. While Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting has been the go-to method for enhancing model reasoning, CoD offers a more efficient alternative that mirrors human problem-solving patterns—using concise, high-signal thinking steps rather than verbose explanations.
articles.author: Ahmed Raafat
articles.content: This post explores Chain-of-Draft (CoD), an innovative prompting technique introduced in a Zoom AI Research paper Chain of Draft: Thinking Faster by Writing Less, that revolutionizes how models approach reasoning tasks. While Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting has been the go-to method for enhancing model reasoning, CoD offers a more efficient alternative that mirrors human problem-solving patterns—using concise, high-signal thinking steps rather than verbose explanations.

articles.title: Faster treatments and support for health workers as AI tackles A&E bottlenecks
articles.description: AI tool helping 50 NHS organisations predict A&E demand this winter, speeding up patient care as government delivers on building an NHS fit for the future.
articles.content: AI tool helping 50 NHS organisations predict A&E demand this winter, speeding up patient care as government delivers on building an NHS fit for the future.

articles.title: Advancing ADHD diagnosis: How Qbtech built a mobile AI assessment Model Using Amazon SageMaker AI
articles.description: In this post, we explore how Qbtech streamlined their machine learning (ML) workflow using Amazon SageMaker AI, a fully managed service to build, train and deploy ML models, and AWS Glue, a serverless service that makes data integration simpler, faster, and more cost effective. This new solution reduced their feature engineering time from weeks to hours, while maintaining the high clinical standards required by healthcare providers.
articles.author: Antonio Martellotta
articles.content: In this post, we explore how Qbtech streamlined their machine learning (ML) workflow using Amazon SageMaker AI, a fully managed service to build, train and deploy ML models, and AWS Glue, a serverless service that makes data integration simpler, faster, and more cost effective. This new solution reduced their feature engineering time from weeks to hours, while maintaining the high clinical standards required by healthcare providers.

articles.title: Sigma launches privacy-focused AI-native browser with local LLM

articles.title: Expanded umbilical cord blood transplant achieves 94% survival in severe aplastic anemia patients
articles.description: NIH clinical trial shows promise for people with treatment-limited, life-threatening disorder.

articles.title: DagsHub now supports MLflow 3.x
articles.description: We’ve shipped support for MLflow 3.x on DagsHub, so you can upgrade your MLflow client and keep using the same hosted tracking server that lives inside every DagsHub repo. No self-hosting, no extra infra, no “where did my artifacts go?” moments.
articles.author: Dean Pleban
articles.content: We’ve shipped support for MLflow 3.x on DagsHub, so you can upgrade your MLflow client and keep using the same hosted tracking server that lives inside every DagsHub repo. No self-hosting, no extra infra, no “where did my artifacts go?” moments.

articles.title: CES 2026: LG gram Pro 17 debuts as world’s lightest 17-inch RTX laptop
articles.description: LG Electronics announced its 2026 LG gram lineup in Seoul on January 2, 2026, for unveiling at CES 2026. The models feature Aerominum material for lighter weight and durability, plus dual AI combining on-device and cloud capabilities to enhance productivity in portable laptops. The 2026 LG gram lineup builds on LG’s decade-long position in ultra-portable […]

articles.title: CES 2026: Vertical RGB pixels arrive to solve OLED text fringing issues
articles.description: LG Display and Samsung Display have introduced vertical RGB stripe subpixel arrangements in new OLED panels to enhance text clarity on gaming monitors. Asus and MSI plan to launch models with this Stripe RGB technology this year, targeting issues in ultrawide displays. Samsung Display announced earlier this month the start of mass production for the […]

articles.title: Announcing OpenAI Grove Cohort 2
articles.description: Applications are now open for OpenAI Grove Cohort 2, a 5-week founder program designed for individuals at any stage, from pre-idea to product. Participants receive $50K in API credits, early access to AI tools, and hands-on mentorship from the OpenAI team.
articles.content: Applications are now open for OpenAI Grove Cohort 2, a 5-week founder program designed for individuals at any stage, from pre-idea to product. Participants receive $50K in API credits, early access to AI tools, and hands-on mentorship from the OpenAI team.

articles.title: Build a multimodal generative AI assistant for root cause diagnosis in predictive maintenance using Amazon Bedrock
articles.description: In this post, we demonstrate how to implement a predictive maintenance solution using Foundation Models (FMs) on Amazon Bedrock, with a case study of Amazon's manufacturing equipment within their fulfillment centers. The solution is highly adaptable and can be customized for other industries, including oil and gas, logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare.
articles.author: Carla Lorente
articles.content: In this post, we demonstrate how to implement a predictive maintenance solution using Foundation Models (FMs) on Amazon Bedrock, with a case study of Amazon's manufacturing equipment within their fulfillment centers. The solution is highly adaptable and can be customized for other industries, including oil and gas, logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare.
